lender.name: Matt
lender.loan_because:
I have mixed feelings about Kiva, so I am pulling my money out gradually. I am instead donating money to organizations like Ashoka.
I encourage people to loan to businesses whose customers are likely to have "higher" incomes than them. This way, money gets distributed downward to those who need it more, and the (whopping) interest rates can be paid without impoverishing poorer communities.
If you loan to a person that has customers that are poorer or as poor as the person loaned to, I think that you are helping to increase the amount of poverty in the area. The interest rates just suck the money out of the poor communities and feed the microfinance institutions and bureaucracies.
Please loan money wisely.

lender.name: Duncan
lender.loan_because: A good friend of mine spent a month in Ghana this year working specifically on microfinance. She came back to Boston and opened my eyes to the incredible and tangible difference loans like these can make. As someone who started my own successful business a few years ago, I know how difficult raising money can be. The challenges I face with my business are likely very different than what my loan recipients face, yet at the same time quite similar. I feel priviledged that I can reach across the world from my desk at work and help to improve the life of someone else who is also striving to make a better life for themselves and their family.
lender.occupational_info:
As an interior designer I am hired by a homeowner to create the interior space of their home. That means putting together a plan for their furniture, carpets, their kitchen and baths, as well as the colors that will be used throughout the house.
I hire carpenters, painters, electricians and plumbers to help me complete this work.
I am usually hired by people who can afford to make significant changes to the appearance of their homes, or by people who are building a new home and need help planning the interior spaces.
Sometimes it seems ridiculous that some of my clients are very concerned with the type of fabric on their sofa, when people are going hungry in other places in the world. But I am in this business because I believe that your environment has a significant effect on the state of your well-being. I work to improve my clients environment because home and family are two of the most important things in the world. This is a universal truth, and I believe that many of Kiva's loan recipients are also trying, by starting or expanding their business, to ultimately improve their environment and the well-being of their family.

lender.name: FireQueen
lender.loan_because: I believe in making a difference, one life at a time.
lender.occupational_info: I'm a writer.

lender.occupational_info: Employed in the Technology Space very much interested in Micro-finance and economic empowerment.

~BARACK OBAMA Ladies' Home Journal, Sep. 2008

lender.name: Hamnett
lender.loan_because:
I believe in the incredible transformative power of entrepreneurship - and the entrepreneur.
The ingenuity, drive, effort and other skills that many show just to survive in challenging environments - is made of the same stuff that enables entrepreneurs to succeed & lift themselves to new heights - quality of life, financial freedom, and self-esteem.
If artificial barriers to entrepreneurial success such as access to capital & credit can be overcome - millions of people will be able to show their entrepreneurial nature and make a difference in their own life, and those around them.
I hope I can be a small part of facilitating that change.
lender.occupational_info: I am a serial-entrepreneur, that has started, built and grown several successful businesses.

lender.name: Don Baker
lender.loan_because: It is a direct way to make a positive contribution to someone's goals. Through Kiva we can all be philanthropists.
lender.occupational_info: I do graphic design, illustration, animation and video work. I volunteer to help nonprofits: http://www.vimeo.com/18501937

lender.name: Family
lender.loan_because: There is enough to go around. :-)

lender.name: Lee Erica

This program gives everyone who'd like to make a difference in someone's life the opportunity to do so. What a wonderful concept with such incredible results.
lender.occupational_info: Currently there are several projects that are holding my attention. Too confusing to get into even for a fellow American to understand. However.. To my new business partners across the world if I could give you one piece of advice. At the end of each day when you look in the mirror make sure the person you see is someone you can make eye contact with. Do your personal best and never ever take food off of someone else's table without asking first. If you can do these two things you will succeed in life and with your business venture.

lender.name: Whitney
lender.loan_because: in this small way I can make a big difference.

My parents immigrated to the United States from India and they literally started with nothing. My parents wanted a better future for their family, thus they worked hard. Till this day I am thankful for all they have done and for how hard they have worked. Through Kiva I feel that I am giving the same opportunity to help one and their family.

lender.name: Vachel
